div.p: Greetings. After I had sealed the previous letters sent to you, behold, the bookbinder brings a booklet.
Therefore, I immediately add a brief letter to the booklet, which you see here; for I have enclosed its first lines here, so that you may see what I have written.

I wrote it for your sake, otherwise I would have written nothing to him; therefore, whatever it is, it stands in your hand. If it seems right, deliver it to him; if it is not approved, keep it for yourself, but nevertheless send me a copy or even the letter itself; give the booklet to whomever you wish. Farewell. March 9, 1565.
To the most excellent man, Mr. Johannes Fabricius, minister of the church of Chur, my esteemed and beloved lord and brother. Chur.
